word_mean: 动脉：血液离开心脏流至身体各部的血管，又称arteria〔NA〕。动脉壁由外层(外膜，tunica adventitia)、中层(中膜，tunica media)和内层(内膜，tunica intima)构成

sentence.Network_en: A muscular spasm in the coronary artery can cause a heart attack.
sentence.Network_cn: 冠状动脉的肌肉痉挛可能导致心脏病。

sentence.Network_en: He had an operation last year to widen a heart artery.
sentence.Network_cn: 去年他接受了一个扩张心脏动脉的手术。

sentence.Network_en: He almost bled to death after the bullet severed an artery.
sentence.Network_cn: 子弹穿过动脉，他失血过多几乎性命不保。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English : from Latin arteria, from Greek artēria, probably from airein 'raise'

entry.def: Arteries are the tubes in your body that carry blood from your heart to the rest of your body.
You can refer to an important main route within a complex road, railway, or river system as an artery .

example.ex: Clarence Street was one of the northbound arteries of the central business district.
example.tran: 克拉伦斯街是中央商业区北段部分的主干路之一。

example.ex: ...the point where the Ohio River, itself a great artery, joins the Mississippi.
example.tran: 本身就是一条主干河道的俄亥俄河和密西西比河的交汇处

means.word_mean: 1. a blood vessel that carries blood from the heart to the body
2. a major thoroughfare that bears important traffic

auth_sentence.content: The inferior mesenteric artery is most commonly affected.

auth_sentence.res_content: He pulled up patients with known coronary-artery disease.

sentences.en: We couldn't feel the changes in the blood pressure within the artery.
sentences.cn: 我们无法感觉到动脉血管内血压的变化。

means.word_mean: 干线（指主要公路、河流、铁路线等）, 要道

sentences.en: This is the place where the three main arteries of West London traffic met.
sentences.cn: 这就是伦敦西部三条主要交通干线的交汇处。

jushi.english: This is the place where the three main arteries of West London traffic meet.
jushi.chinese: 这就是伦敦西区三条主要交通干线的交汇处。

jushi.english: Oceans serve as the main arteries of transportation between continents.
jushi.chinese: 海洋是各大陆间的主要运输渠道。

jushi.english: We couldn't feel the changes in the blood pressure within the artery.
jushi.chinese: 我们无法感觉到动脉血管内血压的变化。
